file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-09-04 - SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the service-door emergency-light assembly and its lamp. B. The service-door emergency light is installed in the service-door ceiling panel and illuminates the exit area in an emergency condition. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT ALL 33-50-09-000-801-A LAMP - REMOVAL SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT ALL 33-50-09-400-801-A LAMP - INSTALLATION SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT AS- ALL 33-50-09-000-802-A SEMBLY - REMOVAL SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT AS- ALL 33-50-09-400-802-A SEMBLY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-09 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the service-door emergency-light lamp. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Passenger cabin (service-door ceiling 234 234ARC panel) C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Passenger cabin (service-door ceiling pan- 1 Does the task el) H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Carefully remove the lens (2). (2) Remove the emergency lamp (3) from the light housing assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-09 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Service-Door Emergency-Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONE B 234 A SERVICE-DOOR DET. A CEILING PANEL (REF.) 1. LIGHT HOUSING ASSEMBLY 3. EMERGENCY LAMP DET. B 2. LENS 145AMM330179.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-09 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the service-door emergency-light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Passenger cabin (service-door ceiling 234 234ARC panel) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Passenger cabin (service-door ceiling pan- 1 Performs the task el) I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the emergency lamp (3) in the light housing assembly (1). (2) Carefully install the lens (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) Do the Emergency Lighting test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-09 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-09-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) The procedures for the removal of the service-door emergency-light assembly are given in the Service-Door Courtesy-Light Assembly Removal (AMM TASK 33-26-05-000-802-A/400). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION SERVICE-DOOR COURTESY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - AMM TASK 33-26-05-000-802-A/400 REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-09 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-09-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. SERVICE-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) The procedures for the installation of the service-door emergency-light assembly are given in the Service-Door Courtesy-Light Assembly Installation (AMM TASK 33-26-05-400-802-A/ 400). B.
